results.title: [Musterrolle: a compilation of short films by Peter Tscherkassky]
results.brief_description: 15 titles create this retrospective of experimental shorts by Austrian filmmaker Peter Tscherkassky. Titles date from 1981 through to the 1999 trailer for the Viennese Film Festival - Viennale. The films work through an experimentation with dissolves, double exposures, the ambiguity of light, found footage and the looping of vision and sound. Sound features heavily in Tscherkassky’s work and the principal composer here is Armin Schminkl. Schminkl also features as a subject for several films in the retrospective. Titles are as follows: Outerspace; The Arrival (L’Arrivee); Happy End; Parallel Space: interview; Tabula Rasa; Shot-Countershot; Kelimba; Manufraktur; Motion Picture; Urlaubsfilm; Freeze Frame; Liebesfilm; Erotique; Aderlab; Get Ready - Viennale ‘99 Trailer.
results.title_for_label: [Musterrolle: a compilation of short films by Peter Tscherkassky]

results.title: [Len Moncur Home Movies: Reel 1]
results.brief_description:
This films shows the 1956 Melbourne Olympic Games, including the opening ceremony, athletes competing in events, decorations in the city and the arrival of Prince Philip to close the Olympic Games.

Selected highlights list:
00:03:51:00 Olympic sign featuring torch, ‘1956’ and the rings
00:08:27:00 cyclists on a velodrome
00:09:57:00 some spectacular diving at the Olympic Swimming Stadium
00:11:44:00 torch bearers running with the Olympic torch
00:13:45:00 the Opening Ceremony
00:20:10:00 Ron Clarke running into the stadium
00:21:00:00 Clarke lighting the cauldron
00:25:35:00 television broadcast vans including the Herald Sun, the ABC and GTV9
00:25:49:00 various track and field events
00:33:30:00 athletes walking up through the crowd of spectators
00:35:41:00 newspaper headlines for Betty Cuthbert’s win
00:41:47:00 Flinders Street Station decorated with the Olympic rings and flags
00:49:00:00 licence plate with Olympic rings
00:49:48:00 on the harbour for yachting
00:51:50:00 the arrival of Prince Philip
00:54:30:00 crowds, including people in costume
00:54:50:00 rows of parked 1950s cars
01:00:52:00 athletes sign autographs
01:02:01:00 a fallen cyclist is helped up by two officials
01:04:07:00 country flags lining a boulevard
01:11:12:00 a brass band
01:16:00:00 Olympic rings lit up at night
01:16:35:00 the closing ceremony

results.title: [Len Moncur Home Movie Collection]
results.brief_description:
The Len Moncur Home Movie Collection is a collection of amateur films made on 8mm film in the 1950s and 1960s. The collection includes a feature-length film of the 1956 Melbourne Olympics and four stop-motion animation titles: ‘The one-eyed monster’, ‘Storm at the 20th’, ‘One fine day’ and ‘It isn’t cricket’.

Len Moncur (1912–1997) was an amateur filmmaker who made home movies and amimation films. With an interest in radio from a young age, he obtained his amateur transmitting licence in 1928, and served in the Air Force during WWII in radar service units. He purchased his first film camera in the USA in 1935, while on a trip visiting other radio and television experimenters, and began making home movies. He made an amaetur television set in 1950, which was shown at the All Models Exhibition, six years before the arrival of commerical television in Australia. In 1957, he joined the Melbourne 8mm Movie Club, where he regularly screened his home movies at film nights. Moncur’s 8mm stop-motion animation films won several amateur filmmaking awards in the 1960s.

This collection was donated to ACMI by the filmmaker’s son Ken Moncur.
